IT CONSULTANT
Career Overview
Network administration veteran with extensive experience building, improving, supporting and architecting ASP-type infrastructures.

Windows Server 2000-2012, Active Directory, Windows Desktop O.S. 7 - 10, Exchange Server 2010-2013/VMWare vSphere (ESXI), Amazon Web Services, EC2, S3, CloudFront, Glacier, RDS, MySQL, MS SQL, Linux Centos 6, Apple IOS, SonicWall, Office365

CERTIFICATIONS:.

01/2001 to 01/2015
IT Consultant
Company Name
Implemented and managed IT infrastructure Designed and managed Windows Active Directory Network (Windows NT 4.0, Windows 2000 - 2012 servers); Managed MS Exchange, MS SQL, SuccessWare21, Symantec Backup Exec, Kaspersky Virus Protection servers, and Sonic Firewalls; Managed and supported Tadiran PBX, AEONIX Contact Center, and CSI (VO) Call Accounting servers; Developed and implemented secure remote access solution for sales consultants and field service technicians; Provided hardware and application support for in-house and field service personnel; Installed, and troubleshoot applications and services on Windows and IOS devices; Network Design and Installation (Windows Networking, Active Directory) Hardware/Software Installation and Configuration Remote Access Solutions, including secure Wireless technologies Email § Database Development Services Performance Monitoring and Tuning Server Sizing and Capacity Planning Disaster Recovery and Business Contingency Planning Vendor liaison and product selection 24x7 network & application monitoring § Comprehensive network support agreements.

City ,
State
Member of global systems integration team.
Provided field service functions in the maintenance, installation, and deployment of networking and document management solutions for law firms and various other clients in the South Eastern United States.
Responsibilities include project management of server and network installations, upgrades, and conversions, daily monitoring and troubleshooting of servers and networks, Citrix Metaframe 1.8, Citrix Metaframe XP, Citrix Nfuse, and 24 hour on call support.
Researched and defined client/server security architecture and provided technical leadership and coordination for the planning and deployment of Citrix solutions.
Techmatics, In., Next Century Integration Develop and provide WAN and LAN solutions for various clients in Windows NT 3.51, NT 4.0, WFW, and Windows 95 environments.
Including, Install and configure Internet access, remote access, system redundancy solutions that included all levels of RAID, and server mirroring technologies.
Promoted to Director of Operations in December 1996, Washington Region: Supervised five employees: Successfully managed various projects in implementing client/server and Internet solutions for various clients.

01/1992 to 01/1996
Technical Analyst
Company Name
Responsible for the installation, maintenance and operation of all computer related hardware and software.
Work with Technology Supervisor and Personnel Supervisor to maintain consistency with regard to word processing procedures among secretarial and word processing personnel and assist with ongoing training in new procedures.
Support all inter-office telecommunications, electronic mail and Internet services.
Serve as the System Administrator to Windows NT LAN supporting 150 users.
Administer SQL Server and PCDocs databases.
Coordinate with other firm offices regarding telecommunications procedures, and implementation of new technologies.
Interact with vendors in acquisition of new software and hardware.
Member of Morrison & Foerster Networking Taskforce: Provided feasibility study that preceded implementing client/server technology into the Morrison & Foerster environment.
This included costs analysis as well as operation, and management evaluations of NetWare, Banyon Vines, Pathworks and Windows NT; Assisted in the implementation of client/server technology in nationwide offices: System integration and conversion from VAX/VMS, Decnet, 56KB to Windows NT, TCP/IP, Frame Relay Network.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Estimator (Stormwater)

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Project Management, Strategy/Planning

Description:
Position: Senior Estimator (Stormwater/Utilities)Industry: Operational ServicesLocation: Remote
Hiring Immediately!
Are you highly motivated, hard-working, and seeking to join a growth-focused environmental consulting & engineering firm? Are you looking for a company that will invest in your development and grow your professional skills? If so, consider a career with Apex Companies.
Powered by record sales, extraordinary client retention, strategic acquisitions, and an entrepreneurial spirit, Apex Companies is one of the fastest growing environmental consulting and engineering firms in the US. We take pride in keeping our clients happy and have earned numerous awards for project excellence. We continue to grow, and we want you to grow with us.
Apex Companies, a leading national environmental consulting and services company, is seeking a Senior Estimator to support estimating stormwater projects throughout the nation. Projects typically range in size from $5K to $1M at commercial, retail, multi-family residential and municipal client sites.
This role will report directly to the Estimating Director, interact extensively with Apex’s National Account Managers, Regional Construction Managers and Regional Estimators, to manage proposal creation, project logistics, project performance, and client deliverables. This position will have a team of Regional Estimators that they will be responsible for managing proposals for uniformity, consistency and quality in addition to meeting strict deadlines.
Your Responsibilities as a Senior Estimator (Stormwater/Utility):· Manage and develop a team of estimators working on stormwater-related construction bid packages.· Review proposal opportunities and procure the relevant information to produce comprehensive construction bid packages.· Review deficiencies identified by Apex personnel to generate construction bid packages.· Contacting regulatory authorities to discuss aspects of violations.· Develop comprehensive scope of work to address the clients needs.· Create bid takeoff to determine quantities for bidding.· Contacting subcontractors to obtain cost quotes for projects and developing relationships for bidding purposes. Reviewing bids to ensure consistency.· Obtaining material cost quotes for proposals. Developing and maintaining material pricing databases for bidding purposes.· Meet client deadlines for proposal development and submission.· Working closely with a growth team on new client work development.· Occasional travel (5 -10%) to review projects or continuing education opportunities.· Actively participate in a culture of safe work practices.
What we're looking for:· Must have 4 or more years of experience as an Estimator for construction, stormwater, utilities, erosion control and/or excavation & grading projects.· High-level comprehension of construction processes, including familiarity with construction materials and estimating quantities.· Experience with estimating software preferred.· Ability to read site plans and develop cost estimates efficiently.· Valid driver’s license and a good driving history are required.· Experience with Deltek Vision is highly desired.· Stormwater experience is a plus.
Why you'll love working with us:· Company-subsidized medical and dental.· Company-paid life, short, and long-term disability.· Paid Time Off, 401k match, tuition assistance, and more.· Cross-training and the ability to work on a variety of projects.· Performance-based bonuses or other incentives.· Working with the best and brightest in the industry.· 1,000+ employee national firm with 50+ locations across the US.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
